website_summaries.verdict: This hand-controlled drone stands out for its various control options and its long flight and short recharge times.
pros: 3 different ways to control the drone: hands, mini-controller, or a wearable controller “watch.” LED lighting
One key take off and landings
Extra rotors, 2 batteries, and a screwdriver
cons: The open rotor design is not recommended for younger children

customer_reviews.title: Fun Drone with a Learning Curve
customer_reviews.text: I got this gift for my younger brother but tested to see if it worked prior to giving it to him. I have included a video to show me launching it but I am not very good with controlling it. I am sure it will be great with some practice. It was easy to sync to the controller and I like that it lights up. It also came with extra propellers.
customer_reviews.author: Chakris Ngeunjuntr

customer_reviews.title: Fun to play with
customer_reviews.text: This drone is pretty simple to figure out. You put the hand brace on and click the button on your index finger and the drone starts up. It’s best to do outside until you get the hang of it. I had a great time playing with it, through I was terrified it would go in the neighbors yard. It’s fun to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: All plastic drone. Lasted less than half an hour.
customer_reviews.text: This drone is made from cheap plastic, similar to a model that you build. As is the case with drones, it tends to fly into walls and furniture as you learn to control it. This drone lasted less than half an hour before it hit a wall and smashed a plastic blade guard and severed the blade attachment. We bought this drone for my adult son with Cerebral Palsy who only has one working hand. We were able to modify the hand control placement so that he could almost fly it one handed, but then it broke.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia

customer_reviews.title: easy to use

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use

customer_reviews.title: Good Drone, Bad Battery
customer_reviews.text: The drone flew great. Once. The battery only took one charge and that was it. It would not charge again. The battery in the teardrop was also dead on arrival. I Had to order new batteries and a decent charger. Instructions were painfully vague. The new batteries arrive next week so hopefully I can fly again.
